intro: Myriactis assamensis, commonly known as the Assam myriactis, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical with a glossy surface and emit a faint aromatic scent. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
